name: Charlie Ray
text: This is a wonderful small Huntsville history center full to the brim with one of a kind artifacts and historical memorabilia. The owners are kind and super fun to talk to. Please visit and look at all the art, history, and listen to stories about the people who really made and build Huntsville Alabama.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We appreciate your feedback and are so happy you enjoyed visiting the gallery and museum!

name: Gary Baldwin
text:
Provides an exhaustive summary of the wide social and economic variety that has formed the Shelby County of today.
Offers an exclusive, detail filled assortment of landmark events. Gives guests an opportunity to see and learn about thousands of artifacts. Contains a wealth of information. Very friendly staff. Knowledgeable and willing to help.

name: David Willis
text: Great, comprehensive history of Shelby County. I must do.

name: David Willis
text: Fantastic place to learn about the history of Shelby County.

name: C Porter
text: Nice old museum of you Rizal town

name: Liz Clayton
text: Terrific resource for Shelby and surrounding counties.  Records are well kept and they are continually working to get as much scanned and available online as volunteer time permits.  Very helpful.  The museum has many terrific artifacts and is very well displayed.   Must take time to see it if you are in the area.  Great resource for Homeschooling as well.

name: Data Glitch
text: A cool place to visit and get some information on the local areas history.

name: Gregory E Wesson
text: Very interesting things to see. Staff friendly and informative.

name: Samira Segreti
text: I love how they turned it into a museum

name: Tiffany Terry
text: AWESOME discovery~ Archives, Museum, quiet... really nice

name: Annie Bateman
text: Tons of fun history in this old courthouse! Must see!

name: Rene Gilbert
text: Very cool place to do historical research.

name: Hewy NoSleep
text: Great museum celebrating Shelby History

name: Taneisha Wade
text: Its ok

name: Richard Fallin
text: Beautiful!!!

name: Beta Castillo
text:
(Translated by Google) All. Is good

(Original)
Todo. Es buen

name: Amy Strickland
text: Wonderful time at the annual Gala! Beautiful home and air bnb

name: Luis Parada
text: Pretty place

name: LaDonna Isbell
text: You only got to see 2 rooms.   They only lived in the house 6 months.   Was NOT worth the 7 bucks.

name: Ben
text: The tour guide was very nice and walked us through every room and talked about Scott & Zelda Fitzgerald.

name: Nikolay Kotsev
text: Nice museum. Although small brings you back to the spirit of the time.

name: Kris Findlay
text: Wonderful museum to visit to get a great idea of Mobile history of the different eras!  Thank you, ladies, for the excellent tour!

resp.text: Kris, thank you for coming to see us!

name: Michael Miller
text: I enjoyed today's tour of the Conde Charlotte house. They have placed representative furniture and decor from various periods in Mobile's history: French, Spanish, British, Antebellum, etc. Great location near the fort. Free parking. Best part was the lovely Spanish-style patio area.

resp.text: Thank you, Michael Miller, for your gracious comments! We do love our entire historic house museum, but I agree, the Spanish Courtyard is lovely. I hope you will come back sometime because we are redesigning the courtyard. The plan is for it to be completed by summer.

name: Clinton Alexander
text: Wow! The sign out front says "Gateway to Mobile's History." It's a fact! Fascinating tour and lovely people!

resp.text: Dear Mr. Alexander, thank you for the wonderful review! We love our museum and the guests who visit.

name: Jorganna Pecore
text: So amazing...great history lesson!!!! And funny tour guides... Beautiful southern charm!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Jorganna, for your wonderful review. We like to give our guests our full Southern hospitality. So glad you appreciated it. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Brandy Rivers
text: They tell different stories depending on who is there but it looks like my families furniture so I like it.

resp.text: Brandy, we are glad you enjoyed your visit here, and it felt so familiar. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Emily Hsi
text:
Marie was a super good guide. She made us feel special . Very interesting historic home. We clicked on a group on while paying . It would have cost $20 for two adults but groupon was $11. Maybe you can find it for $10.
Very worthwhile stop.

resp.text:
Dear Emily Hsi, Thank you for your lovely review. Marie is, indeed, wonderful. And of course, we think our historic home is, too.
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Monika Loving Me!
text: You can enjoy a brief tour of Mobile's first jail and how it has been refinished to display rulership from different civilizations.

resp.text: Dear Monika, thank you for your lovely review and photos. Please come back any time. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Colleen Harris
text: Clay and Marie were so welcoming. Enjoyed the whole experience and learned a lot. Would highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you, Colleen, for your kind words. We love Clay and Marie and the way they make our guests feel. When we received great reviews like yours, we feel like mission accomplished!

name: Catherine Lord
text: Our tour guides, Frankie and Holly, we’re excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed the tour! They even stayed late to finish our tour. We had traced our French ancestors back to Fort Conde and enjoyed touring the places our ancestors had been.

resp.text:
Dear Catherine Lord,
That is fantastic! Thank you for coming by. We're so happy you enjoyed your tour and that it meant so much to you.
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Mika Korvyakov
text: Was very detailed and precise. Revealed a lot about the history of Mobile and civil rights. Gave good and reliable information as well as primary sources. Good place to take kids with many fun and interactive things to do.

resp.text: We are glad you appreciate the authenticity of our tour. We try hard to present an accurate re-telling of Mobile's history.

name: Pete Renton
text: Really sweet and knowledgeable guides made this little museum a wonderful experience. It's set out in a unique way - each room being authentically laid out in a different time, covering the various flags that have been raised over the city of Mobile. Little recipes of the times were handed out on the tour which was another original touch. If only all museums and old houses were cared for like this one.

resp.text: Dear Pete Renton, thank you so much for saying such nice things about the Conde-Charlotte Museum and our docents. It's our aim to make our tours as enjoyable, educational and memorable as possible. It looks like we succeeded with you! Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Linda Oblak
text: My husband and I had a lovely tour of the museum conducted by Frankie and Sarah. Both women are a wealth of knowledge about the museum and Mobile’s history in general.  We will be back again.

resp.text: Dear Linda, thank you for coming by. Franki and Sarah love giving tours, especially to those who appreciate their insight. We look forward to seeing you again. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Janie Chandler
text: We stumbled across this museum entirely by accident and highly recommend it. The tour guides were so excited and knowledgeable; and oh-so-sweet. We only had 60 minutes to spare so they pared down the 90 minute tour for us. Each room in the building focuses on a different era of American history. Beautifully and attentively furnished, and so interesting to learn about!

resp.text:
Dear Janie Chandler,
I'm so glad you happened upon our museum house! Our docents love to tell about the house and all the history surrounding it. We think it is a treasure, and we're happy you think so, too.
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Angelia Davis
text: What a lovely experience! Sarah and Marie were excellent tour guides and very knowledgeable about the house and Mobile history. I learned so much from both! I can't recommend taking a visit to this beautifully preserved and designed historical home in downtown Mobile, AL enough. You won't be disappointed you stopped in and stepped back in time.

resp.text:
Angelia,
Thank you so much for your great review! Sarah, Marie and all of our docents know their stuff -- and love to share their knowledge. We're proud of them and the authenticity of the museum house.
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: David Espenlaub
text: Great historical spot. Docents were very entertaining and informative. Lots of great history in each room.

resp.text:
Dear David Espenlaub,
Thank you for your kind words about the Conde-Charlotte Museum. We're glad you had fun while learning a bit, too. That's our aim. Thank you for coming by.
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Thomas Leach
text: Great historic home with antiques. Docents were very informative.  Well worth the time!

resp.text: Dear Thomas Leach, Thank you for such a nice review, and that you thought our museum is worth the time. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Vicky Altis
text: They are so  informative. Loved the tour. Definately a must see

resp.text: Dear Vicky, We're so happy you come on the tour. And thank you for your kind review. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Allura Wheeler
text: The ladies of the house were very knowledgeable and a hoot! We enjoyed every moment of our tour.

resp.text:
Dear Allura Wheeler,
We're happy you enjoyed our fun-loving docents. They enjoy themselves, too!
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Bama Cushen
text: The tour guide lady's were so pleasant and sincerely interested in the historical aspect of the city!!

resp.text:
Dear Bama Cushen,
We're so happy you enjoyed our tour. The docents really do love our city and the museum. Thank you for stopping by.
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: William Boyce
text: The reps knows what they are doing, very knowledgeable I can say plus they were able to tour us around the place.

resp.text: Dear William Boyce, thank you for touring the museum. Our docents love sharing their knowledge. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Virginia Jackson
text: Freda and Sister were very knowledgeable on the history in the house.  Debbie and I enjoyed the tour.  There is so much history there.  This  was once the jail in Mobile.

resp.text: The Conde-Charlotte Museum, indeed, was Mobile's first jail. There's so much to tell about our museum house! Tell your friends about us; we'd love to see them.

name: lori haggard
text: Had fantastic, witty docents. Marie and Sister. Beautiful home.

resp.text: Dear Lori Haggard, thanks for your lovely review! Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Mercedes Simon
text: I loved it so much from my daughter's fieldtrip it was so fun

resp.text: Dear Mercedes, thank you for coming with your daughter's class. We love helping youngsters step back in time. And the benefit is that their parents learn, too. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Susan Dove
text: Nice place to learn local history.

resp.text:
Dear Susan Dove,
We think so, too. Thank you for coming to see us!
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Linda Thompson
text:
“Very Interesting”
The tour was conducted by two very gracious women! The Conde-Charlotte Museum House has a very interesting history! We enjoyed this tour very much!

resp.text: We are so happy you enjoyed touring our lovely house -- and learned a bit, too. Thank you for joining us, and please come back anytime.

name: Jeremy Brewer
text: The Conde-Charlotte Museum is a very nice museum that does't take alot of time about an hour or two will let you cover the whole museum. There are a few kids activities that could be very fun

resp.text: Jeremy, thank you for taking the time to tour our museum. Our docents love visitors and telling them the many stories about the house, the furnishings and the people who lived here.

name: Jessica Henson
text: We really enjoyed our visit to the museum.  The tour was great!

resp.text: Jessica, I'm so happy you had a good visit!

name: Laurel McLaughlin
text: Great experience and lovely tour guide, Marie.  Highly recommended.

resp.text:
Laurel, Thank you for your kind words. Marie so enjoyed showing you the museum house.
Mary Lee Montgomery
Director

name: Laurel McLaughlin
text: Great experience and lovely tour guide, Marie.  Highly recommended.

resp.text:
Laurel, Thank you for your kind words. Marie so enjoyed showing you the museum house.
Mary Lee Montgomery
Director

name: Michael Giles
text: Enjoyed reading about the history of this Fort and it also has a neat escape room

resp.text:
Michael,
I wish I could accept your five-star review of the Conde-Charlotte Museum; however, it must be credited to the venue you toured: Fort Conde, which is around the corner from our museum house. Fort Conde is, indeed, a fascinating place to visit. Please come by to see us at the Conde-Charlotte Museum on Theatre Street, just off Royal Street by the fort. We are fortunate in that Downtown Mobile is rich in historical attractions!
Mary Lee Montgomery, Director

name: Linda Bollenbacher
text: Enjoyed it!! Staff very friendly

resp.text: Linda, we're so glad you had fun at the Conde-Charlotte Museum. Thank you for coming by, Mary Lee Montgomery, director.

name: Stories With Grandma
text: Great tour, very educational!

resp.text: Dear Stories With Grandma, Thank you for your lovely comments. We hope you gained some good stories to tell. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Robin
text: Loved the tour! Had a great time!

resp.text: Thank you, Robin!

name: Cathie Pollock
text: Learned a lot on our tour.

resp.text: Dear Cathie Pollock, we're so glad you enjoyed our tour and learned from it. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: DARK 2.0
text: I love this place!

resp.text:
Dear Dark,
We are so glad you had a good experience at the Conde-Charlotte House. We love this place, too!
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Neil Swartz
text: Very interesting

resp.text: Dear Neil, Thank you for coming to see us at the Conde-Charlotte Museum! Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Jim Necaise
text: Awesome building

resp.text: Jim, Thanks so much. We're glad you came by. Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Albert Katryan
text: Lots of history.

resp.text: Thanks for the four stars! Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: DARK 2.0
text: I love this place!

resp.text:
Dear Dark,
We are so glad you had a good experience at the Conde-Charlotte House. We love this place, too!
Mary Lee Montgomery, director

name: Sarah Smith
text: My whole family loved this museum! It was very interesting. Loved it was very hands on!

name: King Shybeer
text: The Battleship Memorial Museum was an amazing experience. My son had a very fun time exploring the ship. I appreciate that it is a self guided tour and you can go at your own pace. The price is very cheap and well worth the money. Highly recommend.

name: Marv Baker
text: Overall great opportunity to see the battleship, sub, tanks, planes and displays

name: Cindy Ibert
text: Very nice exhibit and reasonably priced. Had a lot of fun and staff was extra friendly. Lots of things to see and room for kids to run off energy. Pet friendly. Will come back when we come this way again

name: Justin Dupuis
text: Perfect everytime! Ive been like 7 or 8 times.

name: Carmen Iacono
text: Great place to stop off at on the way to Florida
